articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Signs of renewed activity emerged on Wednesday in the quest for a ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas in the nine-month-old war in the Gaza Strip while Israel launched more strikes on the devastated enclave.
articles.title: Gaza ceasefire effort shows signs of revival as Israel pounds enclave

articles.author: Nandita Bose, Andrea Shalal, Jeff Mason
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden vowed to stay in the 2024 presidential race during a call with campaign staff on Wednesday and sought to reassure top Democrats on Capitol Hill that he is fit for re-election, despite his disastrous debate performance last week.
articles.title: Biden reassures governors as Dem kingmakers float mini primary if he quits

articles.author: Maria Cardona, Harold Isaac
articles.description: Hurricane Beryl barreled toward Jamaica as a powerful Category 4 storm on Wednesday, after flattening homes and devastating agriculture on smaller islands in the eastern Caribbean, killing at least three people.
articles.title: Hurricane Beryl, churning toward Jamaica, threatens Haiti and Dominican Republic

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian missile and drone attack on Ukraine's city of Dnipro on Wednesday killed at least four civilians and wounded 27 more, damaging kindergartens, schools, and hospitals and causing fires throughout the city, regional officials said.
articles.title: Russian attack on Ukraine's Dnipro kills at least four, wounds 27 more, governor says

articles.author: Dominique Vidalon
articles.description: French Prime Minister Gabriel Attal, a close ally of President Emmanuel Macron, said he believed a cross-party bid to deprive Marine Le Pen's far-right National Rally of a majority in next Sunday's parliamentary run-off could succeed.
articles.title: Far-right majority can be avoided, French PM says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan told Russia's Vladimir Putin on Wednesday that Ankara could help end the Ukraine-Russia war, but Putin's spokesman said Erdogan could not play the role of an intermediary in the 28-month-old conflict.
articles.title: Turkey's Erdogan offers to help end Russia-Ukraine war; Kremlin rules him out as intermediary

articles.author: Elida Moreno, Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: An agreement between Panama and the United States to try to deter migrants from crossing the treacherous Darien jungle, by repatriating those that enter the Central American country illegally, is unlikely to succeed and could make journeys even more dangerous.
articles.title: Panama deportations unlikely to be enough to curb Darien crossings

articles.author: Carlos Carillo, Ricardo Arduengo
articles.description: Majorie Edoi sells food from a stand in Haiti's capital Port-au-Prince - or she used to, until a conflict with armed gangs cut off the city from suppliers, paralyzed trade routes and pushed the Caribbean country to its highest levels of hunger on record.
articles.title: Camping in schools, hungry Haiti families ask: when will normality return?

articles.author: Shivam Patel, Saurabh Sharma
articles.description: More than three times the permitted number of people attended a Hindu religious event in northern India that culminated in a stampede which killed at least 121 people, authorities said on Wednesday, adding that most of the victims were women.
articles.title: India stampede killed 121 in wake of massive overcrowding, police say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hundreds of pro-Palestinian protesters cleared out tents and tarps on Wednesday from a fenced-off grassy area on the campus of Canada's largest university, where for two months they had held an encampment, ahead of an evening deadline.
articles.title: Pro-Palestinian protesters clear out Canadian campus encampment
